nodes.bodyText: The built-in will also pick source from the main source set only?
I mean the proto codegen will not be picked.
Yes, it produces the same results. Honestly, it would be better to include the generated code in my mind, but it's not that big of a deal.
Why is this removed. Does it work for all JDK versions?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -12,7 +12,6 @@ dependencies {
             project(':grpc-stub')
     compileOnly libraries.javax_annotation
     testImplementation libraries.truth
-    testRuntime libraries.javax_annotation

nodes.bodyText: testRuntime is the old-style. It seemed weird to be runtime-only. It seemed like it should be testImplementation. So I looked at the code and couldn't find a reference to it, so I deleted it. The Java 11 build did fail, so I put it back, but as testRuntimeOnly.

     testImplementation libraries.truth
